[h1] Scientific data suggests Portal increases your IQ level* [/h1]

I should be studying but instead I'm playing video games. 
I'm a filthy procrastinator!
Portal though, unlike so many video games I play, doesn't feel like an enormous waste of time.
I feel no guilt whatsoever...
I still feel somewhat productive, even though I'm still playing a video game...

Portal isn't overly challenging or educational as such but it does require you to use your brain.
It starts off simple enough but gets a little more complex as you progress - at some stage
you may become stuck but it's very rewarding to finally figure out the solution and progress.

You see, unlike most games which offer a challenge, Portal doesn't rely on artificial difficulty, 
overly complicated mechanics, a story that's always in your face and/or bells and whistles, it 
just gives you the tools and leaves you to work things out for yourself. The greatest challenge 
you'll face in Portal is yourself. Your own intelligence! Therefore, as you progress and overcome 
the challenges that Portal throws at you and ultimately beat the game, you can rest assured 
that that dopamine rush and sense of accomplishment is real. It's well earned. No, you didn't 
save the world or anything so extravagant; you actually used real life problem solving skills!

It's that simple. 

Portal is clean, efficient and even minimalist. It's the Apple of video games! Somehow 
this game managed to tick all the right boxes. Not too much or too little. Just enough. 

Though not enough cake... That's my only issue. 
Regardless, I highly recommend this game. 

PS. I am now installing Portal 2. 

*Based on data collected from (1) test subject of the Aperture Science Enrichment Centre.

This is my review for the 2007 game 'Portal'. The game is a classic for a very good reason, the game brings an interesting concept and merges it with puzzles. The story is about a test subject who wakes up in a scientific facility controlled by a sadistic artificial intelligence and must she escape with the help of the only instrument she has--a gun that makes portals. You play as a character named Chell and you meet a robot called GLaDOS. The game is made by Valve so you know that it will be good. If you are a fan of puzzle games then this is an easy buy!

Portal is almost the perfect FPS Puzzle game.

Positives: Physics and controls feel right. Story is entertaining and fun to go through. Puzzles are difficult and fun to play through.

Negatives: It's not Portal 2

Summary: Like other Valve games (With the HUGE exception of Artifact), this one is absolutely wonderful and a game I'll always recommend.

Other Game Recommendations: Team Fortress 2, Portal 2.
